channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DOJ releases more Epstein files. And, immigration court 'no-shows' surged, NPR finds
item.description: The DOJ has released more files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, NPR finds a rise in the number of immigrants without legal sta...

item.title: The Trump administration pauses wind projects off New England, New York and Virginia
item.description: An Interior Department statement did not detail the national security risks. It's the administration's latest pus to hobble offshore wind and limit re...

item.title: 'Music makes everything better': A Texas doctor spins vinyl to give patients relief
item.description: A palliative care doctor in Austin says listening to vinyl music can lift heavy moments for families and patients receiving end-of-life care.

item.title: Rep. Adam Smith says Trump's oil blockade is about power over Venezuela
item.description: Rep. Adam Smith, the Democratic leader of the Armed Services Committee, says Trump's oil blockade is about driving Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro...

item.title: How Trump's 'crony capitalism' has shaken up U.S. business
item.description: His policies are picking winners and losers — and blurring the lines between business and government.

item.title: US lawmakers threaten legal action against Attorney General over Epstein files
item.description: On Monday, Senator Schumer said he would introduce a resolution to take legal action over the failure to release the full files.

item.title: US pursuing third oil tanker linked to Venezuela, official says
item.description: The move comes days after President Donald Trump said that he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

item.title: What's behind the surge in gold and silver prices?
item.description: Analysts point to rising geopolitical tensions and softer monetary policy as driving the year-end surge.

item.title: Trump to make announcement with Hegseth on shipbuilding
item.description: President Trump and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth are speaking from the president's Florida estate.

item.title: Trump's appointment of Greenland envoy sparks fresh row with Denmark
item.description: The BBC's diplomatic correspondent James Landale explains how Trump's appoinment of a special envoy to Greenland has shaken diplomatic with Denmark.

item.title: Illinois members of Congress are latest to tour immigration facilities after judge’s ruling
Brown University shooting suspect was prone to angry outbursts, former classmate says
item.description: More details are emerging about Claudio Manuel Neves Valente, the man suspected of carrying out a deadly shooting at Brown University before allegedly...

item.title: Power mostly restored after massive San Francisco outage affects 130,000 PG&E customers
item.description: Pacific Gas and Electric said about 5,000 customers were still without power Monday after a massive outage over the weekend affected about 130,000 cus...

item.title: Baby followed by BBC back in Gaza hospital after treatment abroad
item.description: The BBC revisits one-year-old Siwar Ashour who was temporarily evacuated to Jordan for medical treatment during the Gaza war.

item.title: Aetna to cover IVF treatments for same-sex couples in national settlement
item.description: A federal judge has approved a preliminary agreement for a class action lawsuit requiring Aetna to cover fertility treatments for same-sex couples as ...

item.title: An American Dream at risk: What happens to a small Nebraska town when 3,200 workers lose their jobs
item.description: Tyson Foods is closing its beef plant in Lexington, Nebraska, laying off 3,200 workers next month in a town of just 11,000.

item.title: Russia escalates attacks on key Ukrainian region of Odesa
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky warned the attacks were an attempt by Moscow to block Ukraine's access to maritime logistics.

item.title: Top Trump administration official defends partial release of Epstein files as Democrats cry foul
